summary.para: The Clone method creates a new enumerator that contains the same enumeration state as the current structure enumerator. Using this method, a client can record a particular point in the enumeration sequence and then return to that point at a later time. The new enumerator supports the same interface.

param.name: ppenum
param.para: A pointer to the variable that receives the interface pointer.
If the method is unsuccessful, the value of the ppenum parameter is undefined.

returns.para: This method supports the following return values.

summary.para: The Next method retrieves a specified number of structures, that follow in the enumeration sequence. If there are fewer than the requested number of structures that remain in the enumeration sequence, it retrieves the remaining STATSTG structures.

param.name: pceltFetched
param.para: The number of structures retrieved in the rgelt parameter.

returns.para: This method supports the following return values:

description.para: The number of structures returned is equal to the number specified in the celt parameter.
The number of structures returned is less than the number specified in the celt parameter.

summary.para: The Reset method resets the enumeration sequence to the beginning of the structure array.

returns.para: This method supports the S_OK return value.

description.para: The enumeration sequence was successfully reset to the beginning of the enumeration.

summary.para: The Skip method skips a specified number of structures in the enumeration sequence.

param.name: celt
param.para: The number of structures to skip.

returns.para: This method supports the following return values:

| Return code | Description | |----------------|---------------| | S_OK | The specified number of STATSTG structures that were successfully skipped. | | S_FALSE | The number of STATSTG structures skipped is less than the celt parameter. |

summary.para: The IEnumSTATSTG interface enumerates an array of structures. These structures contain statistical data about open storage, stream, or byte array objects. IEnumSTATSTG has the same methods as all enumerator interfaces: , , , and .
